author: wsjcom
title: Hong Kong Following the Law in Wong Case
text:
It is not uncommon to accuse courts of being unfair or political if one doesn’t like their decisions. Martin Lee is doing just that in his Jan. 30 op-ed “Beijing Attacks Hong Kong’s Rule of Law.”
As an experienced lawyer in Hong Kong, Mr. Lee should know better. Joshua Wong was convicted because he was resisting the enforcement of a court injunction to reopen the roads in a blocked protest site. He pleaded guilty to contempt of court and was sentenced to imprisonment. Mr. Wong is out on bail pending his appeal.
...
